properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 2:46AM CST until February 13 at 10:00AM CST by NWS North Platte NE
properties.description:
...LIGHT SNOW AND STRONG WINDS WILL PRODUCE POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS
TRAVEL DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY...VERY COLD WIND CHILLS ARE LIKELY
TONIGHT...

.A strong Arctic cold front will move into the area today
bringing the potential for light snow accumulations. In addition,
strong winds will lead to blowing snow and visibility reductions.
As temperatures fall rapidly, a flash freeze of wet surfaces is
possible.

This evening, winds behind the front will combine with bitterly
cold air, producing wind chills as low as 25 below zero in
portions of the eastern Sandhills and north central Nebraska.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as
40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero.

* WHERE...Boyd and Holt Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 9 AM this morning
to 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8
PM this evening to 10 AM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and possible reduced
visibilities due to blowing snow. The cold wind chills could
cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

If outdoors tonight, dress in layers and cover exposed skin to
prevent frostbite.

Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CST THURSDAY
